title: Quiz 4: Malnutrition & Disorders
description: Test your ability to identify and differentiate between various nutritional disorders.

questions.question: Which clinical sign is the primary distinguishing feature of Kwashiorkor?

options.text: Severe wasting of muscle and fat

questions.explanation: Oedema (swelling/fluid retention) is the hallmark of Kwashiorkor, often masking muscle loss.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is a severe form of protein-energy malnutrition characterized by extreme emaciation, 'old man's face', and loss of subcutaneous fat.
questions.explanation: Marasmus is characterized by severe wasting and an 'old man' appearance due to calorie and protein deficiency.

questions.question: Match the deficiency disease with the missing nutrient:
questions.explanation: Goiter=Iodine, Xerophthalmia=Vit A, Rickets=Vit D, Anemia=Iron.
questions.hint: Link the condition to the mineral or vitamin.

questions.question: Which of the following are clinical signs of Kwashiorkor? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Kwashiorkor presents with edema, hair changes, moon face, and apathy. Being 'alert' with severe wasting is more typical of Marasmus.

questions.question: Analyze the table below. Which column correctly describes Marasmus?

richContent.content:
FeatureColumn AColumn B
AppearanceBloated, Moon FaceSevere Wasting, Old Man Face
AppetitePoorGood/Voracious
EdemaPresentAbsent

questions.explanation: Column B describes Marasmus (wasting, good appetite, no edema). Column A describes Kwashiorkor.
questions.hint: Marasmus patients are usually very hungry and thin.

questions.question: Pellagra is caused by a deficiency in Vitamin C.
questions.explanation: Pellagra is caused by a deficiency in Niacin (Vitamin B3). Vitamin C deficiency causes Scurvy.
questions.hint: Think of the 3 Ds: Dermatitis, Diarrhea, Dementia.

questions.question: What is the condition caused by Zinc deficiency that results in impaired sexual development and poor wound healing?
questions.explanation: Zinc deficiency causes dwarfism, hypogonadism (impaired sexual development), and poor wound healing.

questions.question: Identify the dangers of malnutrition from the list below: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Malnutrition leads to muscle loss, poor immunity, and hypothermia. Mobility decreases, not increases.

questions.question: Which of the following is an Iodine deficiency disorder characterized by stunted growth and mental retardation in infants?
questions.explanation: Cretinism is the result of severe iodine deficiency during pregnancy/infancy.
questions.hint: Goiter is the adult form; this is the infant form.

questions.question: Order the general severity of Vitamin A deficiency effects (from mild to severe):
questions.explanation: Deficiency often starts with night blindness, progresses to dryness/keratinization, and can result in total blindness.
questions.hint: Starts with difficulty seeing at night.
